title: About
text:
I grew up in the east Bay Area, but both my parents were born in Hungary and I was raised maintaining my Hungarian identity, which I still proudly foster today. I’m graduating from University of California, Santa Barbara with a B.A. in Environmental Studies in June 2024. My interests within the field lie in climate change mitigation and habitat restoration, which is in itself an important part of fighting climate change. Post-graduation, I’ll be starting a Data Scientist position in the Climate Science and Impacts branch in the Climate Change Division of the Environmental Protection Agency in Washington, D.C. I’m excited to use everything I’ve learned at UCSB in this next chapter of my life!

Outside of work, I like cooking and baking, and I’m known to make a mean banana bread. I also love all things outdoors, including the beautiful beaches Santa Barbara has to offer, biking, hiking and camping. My favorite camping spot has been Santa Cruz Island, the biggest of the California Channel Islands. I’m a big fan of reality tv to relax and laugh, as well as attending comedy shows.

Resume:
resume

title: Other projects
text:
Here are some other notable projects I’ve undertaken as part of my coursework at UCSB:

A case study of California groundwater level data in the past 10 years
Exploring effectiveness of prescribed grazing on restoring native grasslands in San Marcos Foothills Prescribed grazing for grassland resiliency
How methane emissions from mangrives matter for coastal blue carbon accounting
Környezetvédelemmel kapcsolatas szemlélmódok feltérképezése Magyarországon élő és külföldi magyaroknál (Evaluating environmental attitudes between native Hungarians and Hungarianas living abroad) I completed this research project while studying abroad at the Balassi Institute in Budapest, Hungary.

title: Sunset walks
text: Living in Isla Vista, I’ve had the pleasure of taking many sunset walks along the beach, so I thought I’d share some here!

title: Research
text:
While at UCSB, I’ve been lucky to have taken part in the amazing research done here. My most notable projects have been:

Analyzing Plant Tissue Chemistry of Salicornia pacifica in Restored and Established Wetlands
Evaluating the effect of food-based lure and predator scent on detectability of mainland rodents with implications for biosecurity on the California Channel Islands
Assessing agrivoltaic suitability across agricultural land in California through geospatial analysis

title: Kinga Bihari
text: Hi! My name is Kinga (pronounced King-uh) and this is my personal website. It’s a work in progress but I’m excited to share some of the cool stuff I’ve been up to lately. Thanks for stopping by!
